name: 科技促進語言學習研究
description: This course aims to develop students understanding of and critical thinking skills in Technology Enhanced Language Learning (TELL). The aim will be achieved by providing students with an introduction to the past, present and future trends of TELL. Students will engage in studying relevant theories and literature and discussing research trends in terms of the strengths and limitations of TELL. Classes will be blended; a portion of face-to-face instruction will be replaced by webbased online teaching, either synchronous or asynchronous.
goals: Enhance students understanding about the research trends in technology enhanced language learning
Inspire students interests in doing research on Technology Enhanced Language Learning.
syllabus:
**授課方式：16+2 週**

Week 1 Introduction

Week 2 Technology-Enhanced Language Learning: Past, present and future

**Week 3 Peace Memorial Day (No classes)**

Week 4 Game-based language learning

Week 5 Intelligent CALL

Week 6 Robot-assisted language learning (RALL)

Week 7 Mobile-assisted language learning (MALL)

**Week 8 Children’s Day (No classes)**

Week 9 Contextual language learning

Week 10 CALL and Multimodalities

Week 11 Computational thinking and language learning

Week 12 Corpora for L2 teaching and learning

Week 13 AI and Speech recognition for language learning

Week 14 Metaverse for language learning

Week 15 L2 digital writing

Week 16 Teacher education and CALL

Week 17 Seminar Talk-1

Week 18 Seminar Talk-2

methodologies.note: To explain the focus of each topic
To guide students group discussion on the weekly reading assignment
To have students report what they read weekly.

grading.note: Students should actively engage in in-class discussion and participate in the learning activities led by the instructor.
Each student should give oral presentations of his/her reading results.
